IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To cultivate its natural, horticultural, and historic resources for learning, enjoyment and inspiration. The Los Angeles Arboretum Foundation secures philanthropic gifts in support of this mission.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To cultivate its natural, horticultural, and historic resources for learning, enjoyment and inspiration. The Los Angeles Arboretum Foundation secures philanthropic gifts in support of this mission.
IRS990.Desc: In addition to its extensive visitor tour program, the Los Angeles County Arboretum & Botanic Garden offers activities and events that cater to every audience, serving over 500,000 visitors a year. Adult education programs provide instruction in horticulture, the natural sciences, and environmental stewardship practices for use in home, school, and community gardens. Services for public schools provide field trips and other science and history curricula enrichment programs to over 18,000 students annually, with 70% visiting from Title I schools (where at least 40% of students are from low-income families).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Home to one of the worlds finest collections of Mediterranean and subtropical plants, the 127-acre Los Angeles County Arboretum & Botanic Garden serves as an important repository for species of biological and economic importance. The Arboretum landscape also serves as a rich historical site that includes Native American, Rancho Period, and late 19th century treasures, including four historic landmark buildings.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: In agreement with Los Angeles County, the Foundation is responsible for the admissions, filming, weddings and site rentals. Admissions revenues help to support the programs of the Los Angeles County Arboretum & Botanic Garden.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MAINTENANCE AND UPKEEP OF A MEMORIAL GARDEN

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Copies of the Form 990 are provided to the executive committee for review and the treasurer approves the Form 990 for filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Los Angeles Arboretum Foundation Trustees, Board Officers, and key employees receive and sign the annual Conflict of Interest Form where they are required to disclose any potential conflicts of interest to the organization. The board reviews and discusses any conflicts to ensure policy compliance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND OTHER APPLICABLE OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE BY WRITTEN OR ORAL REQUEST TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
